TITLE: For Americans behind on saving for retirement, a bad stock market can be a good time to invest more
SUMMARY: Stock market volatility is an opportunity for small business owners, often the farthest behind in long-term savings goals, to contribute to a retirement plan.

TITLE: That socially responsible fund may not be as ‘green’ as you think. Here's how to pick one
SUMMARY: That impact fund may not be as ‘green’ as you think. There are some simple steps investors can take to make sure their fund aligns with their values.

TITLE: Why the global soil shortage threatens food, medicine and the climate
SUMMARY: Topsoil is eroding at a fast pace due to climate change and poor farming practices that experts say threatens food supply, the environment and water security.

TITLE: Abbott Nutrition restarts baby formula production in reopened Michigan plant
SUMMARY: Abbott Nutrition has resumed baby formula production at its Sturgis, Michigan, plant, in a move that aims to address a nationwide shortage.

TITLE: Kohl's sale negotiations could drag on for weeks, possibly longer, amid market volatility
SUMMARY: This saga at Kohl's has been playing out for more than half a year, which deal experts describe as an abnormal amount of time.

TITLE: Frontier offers $250 million reverse breakup fee if regulators block Spirit merger
SUMMARY: Frontier Airlines' parent company said it would pay a $250 million reverse breakup fee to Spirit Airlines if regulators don't approve the planned merger.

TITLE: Walmart's annual hometown bash returns as retailer acknowledges challenge of inflation
SUMMARY: Walmart's CEO said the company is "taking action to get our costs down" and tapping the expertise from countries with a history of high inflation.

TITLE: Starbucks union creates $1 million fund to cover lost pay for striking baristas
SUMMARY: As of early this week, 100 Starbucks locations have voted to unionize under Workers United.

TITLE: Union claims Starbucks illegally closing cafe to retaliate, Bloomberg reports
SUMMARY: It's the latest escalation between a rapidly growing national labor movement and the coffee giant.

TITLE: The CDC is sending monkeypox vaccines to people at high risk in a race to prevent the spread
SUMMARY: The U.S. has distributed 1,200 vaccine doses to people who have had high risk exposures to monkeypox.

TITLE: Red Bull, Ferrari and Mercedes say 'no way' of staying below budget cap as they fear F1 penalties
SUMMARY: All F1 teams have a cost cap of $140 million for 2022, but a dramatic rise in inflation and freight costs has added unexpected strains, Sky Sports reports.

TITLE: Cramer's lightning round: I like Lam Research over Taiwan Semiconductor
SUMMARY: "Mad Money" host Jim Cramer rings the lightning round bell, which means he's giving his answers to callers' stock questions at rapid speed.

TITLE: 6 exceptional retail winners that Jim Cramer says are a buy
SUMMARY: "As the market trends down here, every single one of these … is a buy," the "Mad Money" host said.

TITLE: Cramer's week ahead: Watch for consumer trends to gauge the state of inflation
SUMMARY: "I bet we'll find that confidence is falling rapidly," the "Mad Money" host said.

TITLE: House Republicans unveil energy and climate plan that would boost fossil fuels, hydropower
SUMMARY: The plan shows how Republicans would address climate and energy issues if the party wins control of the House of Representatives in the November midterms.

TITLE: Walmart to open high-tech fulfillment centers to ship online orders faster
SUMMARY: The retailer is building four warehouses with automated systems that it says will help it pack and ship items to customers more quickly.

TITLE: How the U.S. Space Force plans to police outer space
SUMMARY: Outer space is getting crowded, with both commercial endeavors and secretive military projects. And it's going to be up to the newest United States military branch, the Space Force, to protect American interests there.

TITLE: House Democrats push Treasury, IRS for repeal of rule blocking state and local taxes cap workaround
SUMMARY: Three House Democrats are pushing for relief on the $10,000 limit on the federal deduction for state and local taxes by pleading to reverse a 2019 rule.

TITLE: U.S. monkeypox cases have more than doubled over the last week to 20, CDC says
'Lots of luck on his trip to the moon': Biden shrugs off Elon Musk's economic fears, touts Ford investments
SUMMARY: The president had been asked about Musk after a speech in Delaware touting the solid jobs report released earlier Friday.

TITLE: Lululemon raises guidance as customers keep spending despite higher prices
SUMMARY: Lululemon expects the momentum in its business to continue in spite of broader economic headwinds.

TITLE: 'Buy now, pay later' loans make it tough to get a handle on your credit
SUMMARY: The popularity of "buy now pay later" soared during the pandemic. Now some consumers are realizing this type of credit could be a risky way to take on debt.

TITLE: Stocks making the biggest moves premarket: Turning Point Therapeutics, Lululemon, RH and others
SUMMARY: These are the stocks posting the largest moves before the bell.

TITLE: Dave Roberts is one of the most powerful executives at ESPN – and he wants more diversity behind the scenes
SUMMARY: Dave Roberts oversees tons of programming for ESPN, including the NBA Finals, and he's pushing for more diversity at the network.

TITLE: Sheryl Sandberg sold $1.7 billion worth of Facebook stock over the last decade
SUMMARY: Over the past decade, Sandberg has sold over 75% of her shares through regularly scheduled share sale programs.

TITLE: Gas or renewables? With the world in an unprecedented energy crisis, top CEOs are searching for solutions
SUMMARY: Business leaders weigh in on the energy transition and the potential for solar and wind.

TITLE: Walmart is using its thousands of stores to battle Amazon for e-commerce market share
SUMMARY: Walmart is increasingly relying on its vast network of stores to build out its e-commerce business.

TITLE: Coinbase extends hiring pause for 'foreseeable future' and plans to rescind some offers
SUMMARY: Coinbase has lost more than 70% of its value this year as the turmoil in the economy and market leads to a drop in users.

TITLE: Cramer's lightning round: Trade Desk is too expensive
SUMMARY: "Mad Money" host Jim Cramer rings the lightning round bell, which means he's giving his answers to callers' stock questions at rapid speed.

TITLE: Be ready to pounce on homebuilding stocks the next time they drop, Jim Cramer says
SUMMARY: "I believe these stocks will drop again, but when they do ... I think you've got to pounce," the "Mad Money" host said.
